org.modelio.api.module.lifecycle

Interface IModuleLifeCycleHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultModuleLifeCycleHandler

    public interface IModuleLifeCycleHandler
    The life cycle handler of a module is a set of methods that are called by Modelio on some events related to the module lifecycle in the project (such as starting, selecting, stopping and so on...) This interface replaces the former IModuleSession interface.
    Since:
    3.5

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configurationChanged(java.lang.String pName, java.lang.String oldValue, java.lang.String newValue)
      Called when a module parameter value has changed.
      boolean select()
      Called when the mdac is selected, which corresponds to the user action "Deploy a mdac...".
      boolean start()
      Called when the mdac is started.
      void stop()
      Called before the mdac is stopped.
      void unselect()
      Called when the mdac is deselected from the project.
      void upgrade(Version oldVersion, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oldParameters)
      Called when the mdac is being upgraded from a previous version.

    • Method Detail

      • select

        boolean select()
        throws ModuleException
        Called when the mdac is selected, which corresponds to the user action "Deploy a mdac...".
        Returns:
        if the mdac accepts to be selected
        Throws:
        ModuleException - when an error occurs preventing the module from being selected.

      • start

        boolean start()
       throws ModuleException
        Called when the mdac is started. A mdac is started when:
        • the mdac has just been selected
        • the project has just been opened
        • the mdac has finished to be upgraded from a previous version
        Returns:
        if the mdac accepts to be started
        Throws:
        ModuleException - when an error occurs preventing the module from starting.

      • stop

        void stop()
   throws ModuleException
        Called before the mdac is stopped. A mdac is stopped when:
        • the mdac has just been unselected
        • the project is being closed
        • the mdac is going to be upgraded to another version
        Throws:
        ModuleException - when an error occurs preventing the module from stopping.

      • unselect

        void unselect()
       throws ModuleException
        Called when the mdac is deselected from the project.
        Throws:
        ModuleException - when an error occurs preventing the module from being unselected.

      • upgrade

        void upgrade(Version oldVersion,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oldParameters)
      throws ModuleException
        Called when the mdac is being upgraded from a previous version.
        Parameters:
        oldVersion - The previous version of the MDAC
        oldParameters - The previous list of parameters (key, value)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - when an error occurs preventing the module from being upgraded.

      • configurationChanged

        void configurationChanged(java.lang.String pName,
                          java.lang.String oldValue,
                          java.lang.String newValue)
        Called when a module parameter value has changed.
        Parameters:
        pName - The name of the parameter whose value changed.
        oldValue - The previous value of the parameter value. Can be null.
        newValue - The new value of the parameter value. Can be null.
        Since:
        4.1
